title: Six reasons why tensions over Ukraine are so high
description: As US troops are placed on high alert, Ros Atkins looks at the causes behind the tension on Ukraine's border.

title: US woman finds $3m lottery ticket in junk email folder
description: "I was looking for a missing email from someone, so I checked the spam folder," said winner Laura Spears.

title: Nusrat Ghani: Ex-minister's claims reignite rows over Tories and Islam
description: The ex-minister's accusations prompt wider questions over how the party handles discrimination cases.

title: How anti-social behaviour can devastate lives
description: BBC Panorama investigates what can happen when anti-social behaviour escalates.

title: Hippos can recognise their friends' voices
description: Wild hippos honk to each other and can recognise their companions' voices, a study has found.

title: Whisky and gin worth £66,000 stolen from Glasgow compound
description: Two men used their own HGV to take alcohol worth £66,000 from a compound in Glasgow.

title: The Responder: From police officer to writing a BBC police drama
description: Tony Schumacher based BBC One's The Responder on his own struggles while serving in the force.

title: In pictures: Thierry Mugler's life and works
description: Latex, leather and curves - Mugler reinvented the catwalk with his iconic creations

title: Julian Assange can ask Supreme Court to consider extradition case
description: The Wikileaks founder can petition the UK's highest court for a hearing, stalling his extradition to the US.

title: Comoros goalkeeper crisis could be over for last-16 tie live on BBC
description: Comoros goalkeeper Ali Ahamada will miss their Africa Cup of Nations last-16 tie on Monday despite testing negative for coronavirus.

title: Nusrat Ghani: PM orders Cabinet Office to investigate 'Muslimness' claim
description: Tory MP Nusrat Ghani says she was told her faith was given as a reason for her sacking as a minister.

title: Russian invasion of Ukraine would be disastrous - PM
description: Boris Johnson says an invasion would be painful and bloody for Russia - but war is not inevitable.

title: Australian Open: Fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas battles to five-set win over Taylor Fritz
description: Greek fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas battles to a thrilling five-set victory over American Taylor Fritz to reach the Australian Open quarter-finals.

title: Covid travel tests to be axed in England for double vaccinated
description: Prime minister says a requirement for travellers to take a test within 48 hours will be scrapped.

title: Fury could fight Whyte or Usyk as Joshua camp weigh up step-aside offer
description: Tyson Fury is close to agreeing his next fight and could fight Oleksandr Usyk if Anthony Joshua accepts a step-aside offer.

title: NI rise must be scrapped to help families - David Davis
description: Payments to fund the NHS and social care will too much pressure on households, the veteran Tory MP says.

title: Smeding selected as Team GB's first female long track speed skater for 42 years
description: Ellia Smeding will be the first female long track speed skater to represent Britain for 42 years at Beijing 2022.

title: James Snyder fired from Broadway Harry Potter play over misconduct claim
description: James Snyder was first suspended from the show in November following a complaint from a co-star.

title: Tonga volcano: Eruption more powerful than atomic bomb, Nasa says
description: The eruption earlier this month showered the Pacific nation in ash and triggered a tsunami.

title: Covid in Scotland: Easing of restrictions 'a significant moment'
description: For the first time since Boxing Day nightclubs can reopen and there are no capacity limits on large indoor events.

title: Hundreds of children held by IS in besieged prison in Syria
description: Kurdish-led forces say they are being used as human shields in the jail they have surrounded in Syria.

title: Ford set for England Six Nations recall to replace Farrell
description: George Ford is set to win a recall to England's Six Nations squad to replace injured captain Owen Farrell.

title: Shooting of British scientist was 'senseless act'
description: Matthew Willson was killed when a stay bullet hit him while he was in bed in an apartment in the US.

title: St Neots rower with incurable cancer breaks Atlantic record
description: Kat Cordiner and friends knock seven days off the previous female trio record.

title: The Papers: Russia-Ukraine tensions and No 10 police quizzed
description: The papers report on the partygate investigation and fears that gas prices might rise if Russia invades Ukraine.

title: Liverpool bomber lied to stay in UK, documents released to BBC show
description: New papers emerge, raising questions about why Emad Al Swealmeen was not deported before the attack.

title: Vaccine mandates: 'I lost my job for being unvaccinated'
description: Covid-19 vaccine mandates face stiff resistance in the US, where they are clashing with national ideals of personal freedom.

title: German Covid protests turn nasty in row over rules and vaccinations
description: Tens of thousands of Germans take to the streets every week and politicians are being targeted.

title: Beijing 2022 vs 2008: Two Olympics and two very different Chinas
description: In 2022, the mood, the host government's attitude, and global expectations are all very different to 2008.

title: The people deciding to ditch their smartphones
description: The smartphone users who are ditching their handsets to take back more control of their lives.

title: Srikanth Bolla: The blind CEO’s £48m company which nearly didn’t happen
description: As a teenager, blind businessman Srikanth Bolla sued an Indian state to study maths and science.

title: How will Tonga's broken internet cable be mended?
description: What does its breakage tell us about the problems of getting coverage to remote areas?

title: Sex trafficking: Children groomed in Romania sent to UK
description: BBC correspondent Jean Mackenzie finds children as young as 10 are being groomed in Romania, to be trafficked to the UK.

title: Is anti-social behaviour still seen 'as a bit of bother'?
description: BBC Panorama has found an important tool to help victims of anti-social behaviour is rarely used.

title: Mercedes Gleitze: Film celebrates first British woman to swim English Channel
description: Mercedes Gleitze was the first British woman to swim the English Channel, but kept her accomplishments hidden from her family.

title: Beach Boys star Brian Wilson looks back at his life in new film
description: The Beach Boys star, who turns 80 this year, tells the BBC why he decided to make a documentary.

title: Kenya's 'hidden epidemic': Gender-based violence
description: When Covid hit Kenya, cases of gender-based violence exploded but many cases still go unreported.
